attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Name of the country or subnational area (administrative division).

Concatenation of all administrative division names separated by underscores ("_"), beginning with the country name and ending with the division name for the lowest subnational administrative order (level). The field serves as one for name sorting and ordering.

Identical subnational area identifiers in the Excel table, geospatial data file, and Unicode text table, enabling linkage (joining) of the table records to the geospatial data file polygons as attributes.
First-order administrative division name (ADM1), i.e., regions.
Second-order administrative division name (ADM2), i.e., districts and city councils.
Administrative level "0" (ADM0/country); administrative level "1" (ADM1); administrative level "2" (ADM2); administrative level "3" (ADM3); administrative level "4" (ADM4).
U.S. Government Geopolitical Entities, Names, and Codes (GENC) Standard (for country and first-order administrative divisions only).
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Government Geopolitical Entities, Names, and Codes (GENC), 2021

attr.attrdef: U.S. Government Federal Information Processing System (FIPS) code (for country and first-order administrative divisions only).
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Government Federal Information Processing System (FIPS), 2021

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Annual Five-Year Age Group Population Estimates by Sex for 2015 to 2030 for the national, and first- and second-order administrative division levels of Malawi were prepared by the U.S. Census Bureau for joining (linking) to shapefiles as attribute data. The estimates are consistent with the midyear national projections from the U.S. Census Bureau International Data Base (IDB).
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The U.S. Census Bureau is providing annual subnational five-year age group population estimates by sex for Malawi for 2015-2030 in a geographic information system (GIS) for users of the Spatial Data Repository, funded by the U.S. President’s Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR).
dataIdInfo.idCredit:
CENSUS DATA 2018 Age-Sex Data: 2018 Malawi Population and Housing Census: Assessment of Age Sex Data Quality Report, Annex 1: Distribution of smoothed population by region and district, Malawi 2018. Malawi Government National Statistical Office. Available online at http://www.nsomalawi.mw/images/stories/data_on_line/demography/census_2018/Thematic_Reports/Assessment%20of%20Age%20Sex%20Data%20Quality%20Report.pdf (accessed November 01, 2021).
2008 Population Total Data: 2008 Malawi Population and Housing Census Results, Statistical tables: Population Size and Composition. Malawi Government National Statistical Office. Available online at http://www.nsomalawi.mw/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=107%3A2008-population-and-housing-census-results&catid=8&Itemid=1 (accessed November 16, 2021).
The U.S. Census Bureau cannot guarantee the accuracy of non-U.S. census and survey data.
GEOSPATIAL BOUNDARIES International boundaries coincide with the Large Scale International Boundaries (LSIB) dataset from the U.S. Department of State, Office of the Geographer and Global Issues. Available online at http://geonode.state.gov (accessed November 08, 2021).
Geospatial data for the second-order administrative divisions of Malawi were downloaded from the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Regional Office for Southern and Eastern Africa (ROSEA), available online at http://data.humdata.org/dataset/malawi-administrative-level-0-3-boundaries, "Malawi - Subnational Administrative Boundaries" (accessed November 08, 2021).
The U.S. Census Bureau cannot guarantee the accuracy of boundary placements.
NATIONAL ESTIMATES AND PROJECTIONS U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. International Data Base, December 2020 release, available online at http://www.census.gov/data-tools/demo/idb/ (accessed November 10, 2021).
NATIONAL AND SUBNATIONAL AREA NAMES AND CODES (1) U.S. National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency. NGA GEOnet Names Server (GNS), available at http://geonames.nga.mil/gns/html/ (accessed November 10, 2021). Contains geographic area names from the U.S. Board on Geographic Names and the U.S. Government Federal Information Processing System (FIPS) codes. (2) U.S. Government Geopolitical Entities, Names, and Codes (GENC) Standard. NSG Standards Registry, available at http://nsgreg.nga.mil/genc/discovery (accessed November 10, 2021).

Consts.useLimit: U.S. Census Bureau population estimates: None. Acknowledgment of the Census Bureau would be appreciated in products derived from its population estimates. The subnational boundaries used for this shapefile were downloaded by the U.S. Census Bureau from a publicly available source for this product. The international boundaries are derived from the Large Scale International Boundaries (LSIB) dataset (public domain).

dataIdInfo.suppInfo:
SUBNATIONAL DIVISIONS Malawi's second-order administrative divisions: 32 districts and city councils as of the 2018 census.
SHAPEFILES The original shapefile downloaded from the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Regional Office for Southern and Eastern Africa (ROSEA) had 32 polygons and matched the 2018 census districts and city councils (second-order administrative divisions), after a change to the subnational boundaries by USCB staff: (1) A polygon was added by USCB staff representing the portion of Lake Malawi that falls within the international boundary of Malawi.
This change resulted in a shapefile with 33 polygons, one for each of Malawi's second-order administrative divisions (32 districts and city councils) as reported by the Malawi Government National Statistical Office in the 2018 census, and one for Lake Malawi. Finally, the U.S. Census Bureau aligned the shapefile's national boundary to the Large Scale International Boundary Line (LSIB) polygon file from the U.S. Department of State, Office of the Geographer and Global Issues.
ADDITIONAL NOTE The Malawi Government National Statistical Office uses regions (ADM1) and districts (ADM2) while GEOnet Names Server (GNS) and U.S. Government Geopolitical Entities, Names, and Codes (GENC) consider districts as ADM1. This product follows the Malawi NSO's use of districts as ADM2. Therefore, the FIPS and GENC codes used in this workbook are used for ADM2 rather than ADM1.
FEATURE AND ATTRIBUTE DETAILS The 2015-2030 population estimates for Malawi's administrative divisions are provided in the following two tables: (1) The Unicode tab-delimited text file (table) "Malawi_5yr_age_sex_2015-2030_uscb_jan2022.txt," which can be joined to the shapefile via the common field "GEO_MATCH." (2) The Excel table "Malawi_5yr_age_sex_2015-2030_508_uscb_jan2022.xlsx," formatted for accessibility in compliance with Section 508 of the U.S. Government's Federal Rehabilitation Act.
Details on processing of the census data and calculation of 2015-2030 estimates are provided in the "Census Metadata" tab of the Excel file and "Methods for Calculating 5-Year Age Group Population Estimates by Sex for Subnational Areas" document. For the subnational areas, the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN) "approved" names from the NGA GEOnet Names Server (cited in the "Credits") were used. For any area that a BGN name was not available, the name from the national census was used. Official codes for the subnational areas from the country's national statistical office, when available, are entered in the "NSO_CODE" field in both the text and Excel tables. Information on any alternative area names or recent name or boundary changes is entered in the "USCBCMNT" field. A partial list of the fields in the Excel and Unicode text files, including all fields identifying geographic names and codes, is provided in the Excel file's "Data Dictionary" tab. More detail on the U.S. Census Bureau subnational age and sex group estimates and maps for PEPFAR can be found in the document "Subnational Population Estimates Components for the Spatial Data Repository." It includes a data dictionary that is similar to that in the Excel table.
METHODOLOGY For more information, see the following methodology documents in the Spatial Data Repository: (1) "U.S. Census Bureau Methodology for SDR Subnational Population Estimates." (2) "U.S. Census Bureau Methods for Calculating 5-Year Age Group Population Estimates by Sex for Subnational Areas." (3) "Instructions for Joining Subnational Population Data to Shapefiles."
ACCESS The U.S. Census Bureau’s products for PEPFAR can be accessed from the Spatial Data Repository at http://spatialdata.dhsprogram.com/home/, which also provides access to data and maps from the DHS (Demographic and Health Surveys) Program. A zipped file containing shapefiles with metadata, an Excel workbook with subnational population estimates, and a Unicode tab-delimited text file is available for each country. PEPFAR products are also available on the Census Bureau website at http://www.census.gov/geographies/mapping-files/time-series/demo/international-programs/subnationalpopulation.html for download.
